definition: armored horse/cavalry/metal chimes hanging from eaves/steel barricade/(Tw) bike
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: I put on my safety helmet and the glove, and sat on my silver-white colored bike.
sentences.chinese: 我带上安全帽和手套，帅气的跨上我的银白色铁马。

sentences.english: The implication of the jianmen everywhere a breath.
sentences.chinese: 处处隐含着一派金戈铁马的气息。

sentences.english: It was during the Age of Iron Horse that delivery really started to pick up.
sentences.chinese: 邮政是在铁马时期才开始发展起来的。

sentences.english: The lanky Europe, cannot stop our Kingdom of Heaven's gold armored soldiers and iron horses.
sentences.chinese: 瘦瘦的欧罗巴，挡不住天朝的金戈铁马。

sentences.english: An oil-soaked bird struggles against the side of an Iron Horse supply vessel.
sentences.chinese: 一只受油浸泡过的鸟对著铁马号供应船侧壁挣扎。

definition: fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
to gallop/to spur on a horse/to let one's steed have his head
